request_pathways.name: Patient Request for Health Information — Spanish (HIM-1406S)

forms.document_type: ROI authorization form (affiliated practice — Wiregrass Surgical Associates)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Hospital offers a dedicated 'Patient Request for Health Information' fillable PDF form with 'Myself' as the first recipient option, plus an online Swellbox portal as an alternative digital submission pathway.

red_flags: Witness signature field present with unclear required/optional status may deter patients completing the form at home
bright_spots: Removable media delivery option (USB/DVD/CD) with patient choice of password protection
Co-equal Spanish-language form (HIM-1406S) with identical structure and 66 fillable fields
Swellbox online portal as fully digital alternative to PDF form
Form titled 'Patient Request for Health Information' with 'Myself' as first recipient option
Sensitive information opt-in design requires affirmative consent per category

findability.rationale: Level 5: Prominently available — form is linked directly from the main 'Patients & Visitors' navigation on the hospital website with no searching or creative navigation required.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 5: Fully functional digital workflow — the Swellbox portal provides complete online submission without printing, and the PDF form has 66 fillable fields for fully digital completion before fax submission.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized single-page form with clear logical flow and 13 record-type checkboxes, but has minor clarity issues including unexplained 'ROI' header, ambiguous witness field, and vague fee disclosure.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 5: Process designed around patient self-access as a first-class use case — form is titled 'Patient Request for Health Information,' lists 'Myself' first, acknowledges HIPAA right of access, offers five delivery methods, and provides a co-equal Spanish translation.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities — no notarization or in-person requirements, HIPAA right acknowledged, but fee language is vague ('there may be charges') without specifying amounts or referencing cost-based limits.

overall.summary: Flowers Hospital provides an exemplary patient-centered records request experience with a dedicated fillable PDF form, co-equal Spanish translation, Swellbox portal, and easy findability, earning a strong A despite minor transparency gaps in fee disclosure.
